text.p: Slovenia's listed mineral water producer and health resort operator Radenska said on Monday 1996 net profit eased to 586.1 million tolars ($3.4 million) from 591.3 million a year ago.

"Decline in profit was due to bad weather over the last summer season, which did not only hurt visits to thermal resorts, but also lowered sales of mineral water and non-alcoholic drinks," Alojz Behek, general manager of Radenska, told Reuters.
Radenska, however, plans to pay a dividend of 31.46 tolars per share and to lift this year's profit to up to 600 million tolars, he added.
Sales last year fell to 10.7 billion tolars from 11.4 billion in 1995.
Radenska's market share in sales of mineral water in 1996 was constant between 84 and 85 percent, while their non-alcoholic drinks seized between 16 to 22 percent of the local market.
Radenska exported 28 percent of its production, mainly to Italy, Austria, Hungary, the Czech Republic and Bosnia.
At 0940 GMT Radenska's shares were two tolars or 0.10 percent down at 1,923 tolars on volume of 2,415 shares. -- Novica Mihajlovic, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
